Brevundimonas intermedia is a species of bacteria that belongs to the genus Brevundimonas. It is a Gram-negative, aerobic, and non-spore-forming bacterium.

Brevundimonas intermedia is considered an oligotrophic bacterium, meaning it can thrive in environments with low nutrient availability. It has been isolated from various sources, including water, soil, and clinical samples.

This species is known to be capable of degrading a variety of organic compounds, including some pollutants. It has been studied for its potential applications in bioremediation and environmental cleanup processes.

Brevundimonas intermedia is taxonomically classified within the phylum Proteobacteria, class Alphaproteobacteria, and order Caulobacterales. It is closely related to other species within the Brevundimonas genus, which are known for their distinctive cell morphology and ecological roles.
